snippet.title: The 404 1,467: Where we try not to sugar coat it
snippet.description: Peter Ha drops by the studio to give his overwhelmingly bleak outlook on a number of the latest tech trends.

snippet.title: 'Matrix' model maker 3D-prints sweet figures from sugar
snippet.description: By modifying a 3D printer to work with sugar and water, Julian Sing is able to make figures that look good enough to eat.

snippet.title: Sweet! 3D-printed figures made from sugar (pictures)
snippet.description: Julian Sing combines his passions for 3D printing and baking to create intricate works of art from sugar and water.

snippet.title: The 404 1,467: Where we try not to sugar coat it (podcast)
snippet.description: Peter Ha drops by the studio to give his overwhelmingly bleak outlook on a number of the latest tech trends.

snippet.title: Sweet! Scientists developing sugar-filled batteries
snippet.description: Researchers at Virginia Tech say sugar could be the key to cheap, biodegradable batteries that can be refilled.

snippet.title: The Bitterness Eliminating Coffee Maker makes it OK to skip the sugar
snippet.description: The Bitterness Eliminating Coffee Maker heats water to a consistent temperature. Pouring evenly heated very hot water over coffee grounds can help to reduce coffee's bitter taste.

snippet.title: Netflix preps poison pill to fend off Icahn
snippet.description: The video rental bigwig adopts what appears to be poison pill in hopes of holding off a takeover attempt by investor Carl Icahn.

snippet.title: Lord Alan Sugar steps down as YouView chairman
snippet.description: The Sugar daddy is ditching the set-top box maker, saying his work here is done. He wants to concentrate on his other businesses.

snippet.title: On the prowl for a Facebook sugar daddy
snippet.description: Hot tech IPOs aren't just good for Wall Street -- they also spice up the dating scene. We go to the heart of Silicon Valley to find these rich, eligible bachelors -- and the singles conspiring to meet them.

snippet.title: Spray lights you up when you've got poison ivy
snippet.description: Scratch that itch. Chemists develop a spray-on substance that can identify the presence of urushiol, the oily sap on poison ivy that surely comes from the devil himself.
